meanings.sent1: The prevenient rain made the ground wet before the picnic started.
meanings.sent2: Her prevenient arrival at the meeting ensured everything was prepared on time.
meanings.sent3: The prevenient alarm clock woke him up early, much to his annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The prevenient sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The prevenient snowfall hinted at the winter wonderland to come.

meanings.definition: Anticipatory; preceding in order or importance.
meanings.sent1: His prevenient excitement for the party made him plan every detail in advance.
meanings.sent2: The prevenient warning signs allowed them to evacuate before the storm hit.
meanings.sent3: The prevenient gift from her friend was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her prevenient decision to save money paid off when an unexpected expense arose.
meanings.sent5: The prevenient applause signaled the success of their performance.
